data.text: @RickyNations @SenHydeSmith @SenatorWicker Thank you for clarifying. In a perfect world the Federal Government shouldn’t have its fingers in everybody’s business including insurance. Big brother had gotten way too big.

@SenHydeSmith @SenatorWicker WE THE PEOPLE need the Save Act passed ma’am. That is all for now. We don’t care about anything else right now. How can you not serve the people who elected you? You’re supposed to have our best interest in mind. 👀
@jws14500 @SenHydeSmith @SenatorWicker Remember the federal government provides flood insurance, crop insurance, Medicaid, and Medicare.

@jws14500 @SenHydeSmith @SenatorWicker Jim, I’m sure you mean well but the National Flood Insurance Program was started by the feds in 1969 because private companies wanted  no part of that risk. In the last ten years, private flood that equals or betters the NFIP has become more available of the better risks.

@SenHydeSmith @SenatorWicker If nobody buys their insurance then the Law of supply and demand should bring prices down. More Government intrusion is not the answer. Let the markets do what they do best-price discovery. You and Wicker have done enough damage already. Take a break until after the midterms.
@SenHydeSmith @SenatorWicker You voted to send taxpayer money to fraudsters!

@SenHydeSmith @SenatorWicker Even Wicker condemned Trump’s recently posted video depicting the Obamas as monkeys.  Silence from you.  Ya sure don’t ever want to criticize Trump!  Or ruffle the feathers of your racist constituents.
@SenHydeSmith @SenatorWicker Starting to get it are we ? https://t.co/6624RWIEht
